techmeme.title: LemFi, a financial and payment services platform designed for immigrants that claims to have over 1M active users, raised a $53M Series B led by Highland Europe (Tage Kene-Okafor/TechCrunch)
PUBG developer Krafton, whose Seoul-listed shares are up more than 70% since early 2024, plans to invest over $136M in 2025 in more than a dozen game studios (Yoolim Lee/Bloomberg)
Analysis: the ten leading chip companies cut their fiscal 2024 capex by a combined $9.5B from initial plans due to a weakening demand for smartphones and EVs (Nikkei Asia)
Tether plans to relocate its corporate entity and subsidiaries to El Salvador after obtaining a digital asset service provider license in the country (Emily Nicolle/Bloomberg)
AI will face different rules in Northern Ireland and Britain as the EU's AI Act takes effect next month, potentially causing friction in the UK's tech sector (Financial Times)
